item.title: Weiwei to the Serpentine
item.author: Laura Johnston,
item.description: Walking up from College, along West Carriage Drive through Hyde Park, it’s easy to miss The Serpentine Gallery’s latest pavilion. Contained underground, it will quickly become West London’s coolest summer hangout. But what makes this installation particularly interesting is the story behind it and …

item.title: Going dotty for Kusama
item.author: Laura Johnston,
item.description: The disturbed mind of Yayoi Kusama is a fascinating place. An artist with links to Georgia O’Keefe, Andy Warhol and Joseph Cornell, her art is inspired by her own hallucinations and her outlook on the world. Even before arriving at the exhibition entrance, you have already been greeted by huge red …

item.title: Sexagenarian eager beavers
item.author: Laura Johnston,
item.description: The auditorium dims, the stage lights go up, and I’m faced with a sixty-six-year-old woman lying on a bed, masturbating to phone sex. It is safe to say I didn’t know what I was getting myself into when I agreed to review A Round-Heeled Woman and I admit, I’m still a bit shell-shocked. The play is …

item.title: Having a fashion fling online
item.author: Laura Johnston,Saskia Verhagen,Alice Yang,
item.description: Style Bubble Susanna Lau (aka Susie Bubble) is undoubtedly Britain’s most followed fashion blogger. The London-based 28-year-old, who once wrote about sneaking into fashion week shows, claiming, “If you’re ballsy enough to act like you’re somebody, SOMEONE’s gonna fall for it eventually,” now graces …
